Question: Are transient errors retryable, and which HTTP codes indicate retry vs fail if any?
Why / Details: Help to implement robust retry/backoff. Help to implement retry strategy that avoids hammering the API, handles transient failures, respects server signals, and prevents synchronized retry storms.
Example / Notes: E.g. retry only on transient errors: 429, 502, 503, 504, timeout/network glitches. Do NOT retry 4xx client errors (400,401,403,404) except 429. if Retry-After header present, wait that long (seconds or HTTP-date).
